Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' footage and cockpit recordings reveal how growing trends in pilot fatigue, stress, and boredom are jeopardizing flight safety.

Clip.Title: SAMURAI HEADHUNTERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Since the eighth century, the Samurai have held a special place in Japanese history and culture. But over the years, legend has obscured the truth about how these elite knights actually lived, loved, fought, and died. Using rare 16th century war documents, we tell the story of a Samurai coming of age during that time. Witness his rise from peasant boy to foot soldier to ruthless warrior, all brought to life through stunning re-enactments and expert testimony from Japanese and martial arts historians.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Her husband lies wounded, unable to walk, so Laura Secord sets out on a long journey to warn the British of a possible American attack.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: As technology advances, discover why we must respect Mother Nature as the ultimate power on this planet.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Americans are invading and Lower Canada is undermanned, forcing Charles de Salaberry to rely on cunning tactics.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Her husband lies wounded, unable to walk, so Laura Secord sets out on a long journey to warn the British of a possible American attack.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: Progeny of the Queen Sheba: Yemen & Saudi Arabia
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With the end of the civil war, the people of Yemen are now building a new country and excavating the remains of the palace of the Queen of Sheba as a way of regaining Yemeni ethnic pride.

Clip.Title: MLK: THE ASSASSINATION TAPES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The story of the last days of Dr. Martin Luther King told through rare television and radio news accounts, many not seen or heard since 1968.

Clip.Title: THE HUNT FOR BIN LADEN
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The inside story of the 20-year, billion dollar hunt for Osama bin Laden is revealed, featuring accounts from White House, intelligence, and military leaders involved in his capture.
